greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: McKay-Thompson series of class 18D for the Monster group with a(0) = 1.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = -1..1000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of psi(q) / (q * psi(q^9)) = 1 + chi(-q^9)^3 / (q * chi(-q^3)) in powers of q where psi(), chi() are Ramanujan theta functions.
Expansion of eta(q^2)^2 * eta(q^9) / (eta(q) * eta(q^18)^2) in powers of q.
G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (18 t)) = 3 g(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t) and g() is the g.f. for A128770.
G.f. A(x) satisfies 0 = f(A(x), A(x^2)) where f(u, v) = v * (u^2 + 3) - (u + v)^2.
G.f. A(x) satisfies 0 = f(A(x), A(x^3)) where f(u, v) = u * (u^2 - 3*u + 3) * (v^2 - 3*v + 3) - v^3.
A132976(n) = -(-1)^n * a(n). Convolution inverse of A124243.
mathematica: a[ n_] := If[ n < -1, 0, SeriesCoefficient[ EllipticTheta[ 2, 0, q^(1/2)] / EllipticTheta[ 2, 0, q^(9/2)], {q, 0, n}]];
QP = QPochhammer; s = QP[q^2]^2*(QP[q^9]/(QP[q]*QP[q^18]^2)) + O[q]^100; CoefficientList[s, q] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Nov 14 2015, adapted from PARI *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = my(A); if( n<-1, 0, n++; A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( eta(x^2 + A)^2 * eta(x^9 + A) / (eta(x + A) * eta(x^18 + A)^2), n))};
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Sep 02 2008
